title.rendered: Bhaja Caves, Ancient Evidences of Invention of Tabla

content.rendered:
Bhaja Caves are group of 22 rock cut carved beautiful caves. Located on a hill near Bhaja, Karli near Lonavala in Maharashtra. Represents finest ancient rock cut Buddhist architecture. It is strong believe that these caves are on lies on a major trade route which was ran from Arabian Sea towards the eastern region of India. All the caves were carved at the Hinayana phase. Carbon dating suggest that these caves were carved in 3rd century BC to 2nd Century AD. Buddhist peoples used these caves till 5-6th century AD, they’ve painted some of beautiful Buddha images on the walls of the Chaityagrha. These all caves are located nearby from the famous river Indrayani, which was the source of water at that time.

This places also experience the occupation of Maratha during the medieval period. Large windows were carved into rock to light interior part of the caves. The main cave features large hall called Chaitya, which was carved for praying. Carbon dating proves that this hall was carved way back in 1st century BC, and probably the largest carved Chaityagrha in India. Measures 148 feet long and has 46 feet in height, which features sculptures of both males, females, as well as sculptures of lions and elephants. When you reach at the last cave you can find water fall during rainy season, which store the water at a small pool which is present at the bottom.

Ancient Evidences of Invention of Tabla

Bhaja Caves are group of 22 rock cut carved beautiful caves. Located on a hill near Bhaja, Karli near Lonavala in Maharashtra. Represents finest ancient rock cut Buddhist architecture. It is strong believe that these caves are on lies on a major trade route which was ran from Arabian Sea towards the eastern region of India. All the caves were carved at the Hinayana phase. Carbon dating suggest that these caves were carved in 3rd century BC to 2nd Century AD. Buddhist peoples used these caves till 5-6th century AD, they’ve painted some of beautiful Buddha images on the walls of the Chaityagrha. These all caves are located nearby from the famous Indrayani River, which was the source of water at that time.

These Places also experience the occupation of Maratha during the medieval period. Large windows were carved into rock to light interior part of the caves. The main cave features large hall called Chaitya, which was carved for praying. Carbon dating proves that this hall was carved way back in 1st century BC, and probably the largest carved Chaitya griha in India. Measures 148 feet long and has 46 feet in height, which features sculptures of both males, females, as well as sculptures of lions and elephants. When you reach at the last cave you can find water fall during rainy season, which store the water at a small pool which is present at the bottom.

Nearby Places to Visit

Lonavala itself is a major tourist destination of Maharashtra during all seasons. Other nearby attractions is Karla Leni another master piece of Buddhist rock cut cave. Bedsa caves are also nearby to this place.

Best Time to Visit

Lonavala is well known hill station which you can visit at any time of year. The area near these caves enjoys nice healthy climate, which suits all type of tourists.

How to Reach

Because Lonavala is major hill station of Maharashtra, enjoys great connectivity to rest of the cities of India. Pune is at just 60 km away from this venue where you can get flights for major cities in India.

Suggested Tours

  • Buddhist Tour Packages
  • Ajanta Ellora Caves Tour
  • Buddhist Pilgrimage Tour
  • Buddhist Train Tour
  • Buddhist Tour with Golden Triangle
  • India Nepal Buddhist Tour
  • Footsteps of Buddha Tour
